name: New Star
startIntroPart1: Greetings upon you, Willand Keiji of New Star. Ever since the Cataclysm happened, you managed to hold on to a spark of hope, and stoked that spark in others' hearts. Despite the harshness of post-collapse old Earth, you and your people held on to your hopes and dreams tightly. When you recovered an intact colony ship, you decided that mankind's hopes and dreams should live on in the stars - and thus a New Star joins the others in space.
startIntroPart2: Willand, your people look to you to keep that spark of hope aflame. Will you spread that hope in this new world? Can you build a colony that stands the test of time?
declaringWar: Let's go!
attacked: Everyone! Defense Positions!
defeated: This is... not the end.
introduction: A dream. That's all it takes to keep going.
tradeRequest: We both stand to gain from this.
uniques: Resting point for Influence with City-States is increased by [15]

civilopediaText.text: 'When the Cataclysm happened, there were many that felt lost. Like the world was too far gone. I always had hope, but sometimes it's hard to keep it. Ever since we came out, the world has felt like a jungle. Ruled by wild beasts.'

'But I got lucky. I found my platoon. My family. I think people seem to forget it, but fundamental rights? Democracy? Those were the result of natural progress. Of us seeing what worked, and what didn't. And as long as we keep marching backwards like this, we will never be better. The world had given me a second chance. And so I give you one as well. We go around the world gathering people like us. That see the world not for what it. But for what it can be. A New Star.'

name: Hexlock
startIntroPart1: Greetings, Aura of Hexlock Corporation. Before the Cataclysm of Old Earth, your company was among the forefront in science - but your progress was hindered by the ethics comittee. Freed from that shackle post-Cataclysm, you kept experimenting and iterating through the problems of the post-Cataclysm world, which culminated in the development of your own colony ship. A new experiment await in the depths of space.
startIntroPart2: Aura, your mind craves intellect. Will you successfully conduct a new social experiment in this brand new planet? Can you build a colony that stands the test of time?
declaringWar: Congratulations. You will help me test my new advancements.
attacked: Now isn't that interesting?
defeated: Will this be the end? MmMmmMMmnNn I wonder?
introduction: Hello-o. Anyone to spare for a science experiment?
tradeRequest: This Shipment was brought to you by Hexlock Technologies.
uniques: Can Mix Unique Strategic Resources to Generate a Great Person
[+10]% Production towards any buildings that already exist in the Capital
[Purge Robot] units gain the [Promotion Nullifier] promotion
May buy [Military] units with [Science] for [6] times their normal Production cost
Nullifies [Happiness] [in all non-occupied cities]  <when between [20] and [-10] Happiness>

civilopediaText.text: 'I will admit. There were times were even I felt stumped. Science is supposed to be free. To let you discover things to your heart's content without a single care. But for every step forward, there are some who wish to take two steps backwards. With their arbitrary regulations and limits. They had a system meant to hinder your progress. They... are gone now.'
'For Hexlock, this new world is a paradise. Free to research whatever you want, however you want. No limits. Tell me. What will you bring this world next?'

name: Children of Rust
startIntroPart1: Hau, Scarlett, leader of the Children of Rust. Your people have survived the decivilization of old Earth, scavenging the great old ruins for survival. Yet, your people endured the old Earth, kept traditions old and new alive, and prospered despite the dangers. So when you managed to salvage an unfinished colony ship, your people readily followed you to the far reaches of the stars.
startIntroPart2: Scarlett, your people dream of the open prairie and the lush forests of this new world. Will you lead them to prosper in this new world? Can you build a colony that stands the test of time?
declaringWar: Now you will reap what you have sown.
attacked: We never expected that you could leave us to live in peace. Destruction is in your blood.
defeated: Your legacy is nothing but death.
introduction: So, you have returned! While the world died, what hole did you hide in? The cities you left behind are our inheritance.
hateHello: What will it take? When the last tree has burned and the last child has starved, will you then be satisfied, great leader?
afterPeace: Viracocha has frowned upon our war, and has agreed to our peace agreements.
tradeRequest: This is the property now of the Children. What price will you pay?

[+1 Science] from [Luxury resource] tiles [in all cities]

All units move through Forest and Jungle Tiles in friendly territory as if they have roads. These tiles can be used to establish City Connections upon researching the Wheel.

name: Blackwarden
startIntroPart1: Greetings, VP Eric Price of Blackwarden. Since before the decivilization of old Earth, your company had thrived in the private security business. Your skilled operators helped you survive and prosper in the wastelands of old Earth, using whatever means necessary. When you finally built your own colony ship, it is to look for new prospects in the stars.
startIntroPart2: VP Eric, this new world is in dire need of your private military services. Will you thrive upon the conflict in this new planet? Can you build a colony that stands the test of time?
declaringWar: It's time for you to join the Blackwarden family.
attacked: Competitiveness? It's one of our core values.
defeated: I'm sure we can come to an agreement. Let me send you my resume.
introduction: You've reached the office of Eric Price, VP of mergers and acquisitions, Blackwarden, incorporated. Here at Blackwarden, the comfort and security of our shareholders is our number one priority.
tradeRequest: This is a great opportunity for you. It would be unwise to refuse.

[+10]% Strength <for [All] units> <when fighting in [Foreign Land] tiles> <while the empire is happy>

civilopediaText.text: With over 250,000 employees across 40 nations, Blackwarden Associates is the first choice for any situation requiring a professional and discreet security solution. Our friendly, highly trained personnel are always ready to help  - from your local bank or supermarket, to immigration processing centers and border defense at home, to fallout remediation and nuclear site security in the Indus Exclusion Zone.

name: Atlas
startIntroPart1: Greetings, CEO John Kruger of Atlas Corporation. Your vault had sheltered brilliant citizens, who managed to rebuild in the midst of the decivilization of old Earth. In time, your society developed in scientific leaps and bounds, up to the point that space colonization is feasible.
startIntroPart2: CEO John, your scientists and engineers desire to study and learn from this new planet. Will you achieve great advances in science once more? Can you build a colony that stands the test of time?
declaringWar: All that is required for the triumph of evil is for good men to do nothing.
attacked: You're breaking the non-aggression principle!
defeated: It is our wealth that you use while destroying us.
introduction: I'm John Kruger, CEO of the Atlas Corporation. I thought we were the sole outpost of civilization in a world ruled by barbarism.
hateHello: I do not share your evil or sink to your concept of morality.
tradeRequest: Free trade is the only fair trade.
uniques: Receive free [Great Scientist] when you discover [Computing]
[+100] [Culture] whenever a Great Person is expended
[+100]% Food consumption by specialists [in all non-occupied cities]

civilopediaText.text: At the Refuge, I am creating more than a town, more even than a polity; it is a new world, where individuals will be free to act without the burden of taxation or the specter of injustice. Here, I have created a truly voluntary society, where the citizens associate in rational self interest; from love, not from fear of punishment. I have sent you this invitation because you have greatness within you; think of all you have achieved in your life, and how much more you could do, if you were not held back.

name: Commonwealth
startIntroPart1: Greetings, President Hawkins of the Commonwealth. Your country rose from the wasteland as a democratic union of nation-states that arose from the ashes of a decivilized Earth. In time, your trading posts grew in number, and people flock to your land in promise of a better life. As the Commonwealth grew and prosper, your sights are now set on distant worlds.
startIntroPart2: President Hawkins, your people seek prosperity in this new world. Will you send out your trade caravans once more? Can you build a colony that stands the test of time?
declaringWar: We must take action now, before it is too late.
attacked: You only repeat the mistakes of the past!
defeated: Now, the responsibility falls to you...
introduction: Welcome to the Commonwealth. I am the elected President, Estelle Hawkins. Take heart. Together, we can rebuild our civilization.
tradeRequest: Greetings. I believe this is a fair proposal for both parties. What do you think?
uniques: Military Units gifted from City-States start with [+10] XP
Each city founded increases culture cost of policies [-20]% less than normal

name: The Patriots
startIntroPart1: Ten-hut, General Cameron of the Patriots! Your soldiers withstood the worst of the decivilization of old Earth from your mountain bunkers and underground bases, and managed to bring martial order to the surrounding lands. With your pre-collapse armory, you've secured enough technological progress and material to ensure the next step of the plan: to spread your brand of patriotism towards the stars.
startIntroPart2: General Cameron, your soldiers are ready for action. Will you fly the flag of freedom and liberty high and proud once more? Can you build a colony that stands the test of time?
declaringWar: You're either with us, or you're with the terrorists.
attacked: Disperse immediately. Insurrection and rebellion will be met with lethal force.
defeated: We today have concluded an agreement to end the war and bring peace with honor.
introduction: This is General Cameron of the Army. A state of emergency is currently in effect across the nation. Military authorities are authorized to summarily enforce order, in accordance with martial law. Maintain your shelters and await further instructions.
neutralHello: A water tax of 25% is in place for all municipalities to support disaster relief efforts and the restoration of government.
hateHello: A special water tax rate of 33% is in place for your municipality. You are additionally required to surrender all military weapons.
tradeRequest: The Emergency Management Agency has prepared this aid package for your district.

name: Enclavers
startIntroPart1: Hello, First Citizen Timothy D. West of the Enclave. Your people were once doomsday preppers, independent survivalists who banded together to brave the decivilization of old Earth. Now that you've managed to bring back a semblance of civilization, it is time to reach the stars in your own colony ship.
startIntroPart2: First Citizen Timothy, your people seek a new beginning in this planet. Will you keep your freedom in this exoplanet? Can you build a colony that stands the test of time?
declaringWar: Not on our watch!
attacked: You'll have to take it from our cold, dead hands!
defeated: You can never take my freedom!
introduction: I'm Timothy D. West, First Citizen of the Enclave. You are welcome to trade here as long as you respect our rights. We'll be watching.
hateNo: We are not agreeing to that!
afterPeace: Alright, let's settle down and try to get along.
tradeRequest: Let's make a fair trade, as equals.
uniques: Units ignore terrain costs when moving into any tile with Hills
No Maintenance costs for improvements in [Hill] tiles

civilopediaText.text: Take a look out there, kid. There used to be green trees everywhere, and bright blue water, and white snow on the mountain tops. I know it's hard for you to believe, but there was a time when everything wasn't covered in ash. But those dumb sons of bitches had to go and ruin it all. They didn't know how good they had it, and they killed themselves. But they didn't kill us. Know why? Because we knew how to survive, that's why. We knew how to make do with less, how to hide when they came hunting, and how to hit them where it hurt. That's why we're still here. And that's why we're going to keep living.

The world looks like shit right now, but it's our land and we love it, and we're going to till that soil and grow things from it, and make this place livable again. Now get out there and make us proud, kid.

name: Deadrock Clan
startIntroPart1: Salutations, Great Father Karl of the Deadrock Clan. You've managed to unite several gangs that roamed the decivilized Earth and became the first post-collapse organized crime boss. Vices of all kinds are in your control, but still you seek more ways to profit. The answer came in the form of a salvaged colony ship, and you knew you just have to find a new world to capitalize.
startIntroPart2: Boss Karl, your underlings are restless. Will you spread your influence over the seedy underbellies of this new world? Can you build a colony that stands the test of time?
declaringWar: You are mine!
attacked: As you were warned, if you dare mess with any one of us, you're messing with me, and my entire Clan!
defeated: You think this is over? You had better watch your back...
introduction: Greetings from the Deadrock Clan, and its Great Father Karl. Just a friendly reminder: Never touch our secrets, never mess with us, or you'll be dead in no time.
neutralHello: This is the encrypted channel of Deadrock Clan.
hateHello: You're on our blacklist now. Think twice before you want to do anything with my Clan.
tradeRequest: Let's talk about some business affairs.
uniques: When conquering an encampment, earn [25] Gold and recruit a Barbarian unit <with [67]% chance>
City-State Influence recovers at twice the normal rate

name: Crimson Legion
startIntroPart1: Hail, Caesar, leader of the Crimson Legion! The Decivilization of old Earth has led you to unite several raider gangs under an older civilization's mantle: that of the Roman Empire. Under your military might, city-states fell under your wing, either subjugated and sold as slaves or surrendering as workforce. You've conquered enough land to turn your gaze skywards, towards the heavens, towards a new world.
startIntroPart2: Caesar, your army is ready at your command. Will you lead them to conquest and victory in this new land? Can you build a colony that stands the test of time?
declaringWar: You have stood in the way of progress for too long.
attacked: Do you really believe that you can stand against the tide of history?
defeated: You have the strength to prevail. So be it.
introduction: Hail. I am Caesar, son of Mars, Consul of the Crimson Legion. Have you come to pay tribute?
hateHello: Your misplaced ideals make you weak.
tradeRequest: I offer this, for your consideration.
uniques: [+50]% XP gained from combat <for [Military] units> <when below [50] HP>
[-33]% Unhappiness from [Population] [in all cities with a garrison] <when at war>
[+50]% Production when constructing [Military] units [in all cities] <when at war>

civilopediaText.text: Behold! The nations of the past have fallen, their once marvelous cities crumbled into dust. And why? Because they were weak! In their hour of necessity, they could not stand together! They turned on themselves and devoured themselves, and now they are dead. But we are alive, because we are strong! And what is the source of our strength? Our unity! Like the fasces, we are bound together, and with the strength of our bond, we shall rebuild civilization!
Our enemies are many, but like the nations of old, they are weak and divided. They shall fall before us, and the world shall at last be united under one great banner! Hail victory! Hail Caesar!

name: Cult of Ignis
startIntroPart1: Praise Ignis, Ignitor Martina of the Cult of Ignis. Your beliefs of the Divine Engine had took root upon the decivilized Earth, galvanizing raiders and survivors to unite under your religion. Both progress and conquest had led you to see the possibility of finding the Divine Engine in the stars above, and the Divine Engine had seen fit to bless your cult with a colony ship.
startIntroPart2: Ignitor Martina, your cultists clamor to spread the rumble of the Divine Engine upon this new world. Will you carry out the will of the Divine Engine? Can you build a colony that stands the test of time?
declaringWar: Rejoice! Your profane forms will soon become one with the Exhaust!
attacked: Your offering is welcome! We shall oxidize together in blessed combustion!
defeated: Though our worldly bodies fail, our spirits soar through the skies in oxides immortal...
introduction: The sybil has foreseen this meeting! I am Martina, Ignitor and High Priest. I serve the Divine Engine, and so too shall you.
neutralHello: In the name of the trinity, I permit your words be heard.
hateHello: You risk the wrath of the Flame.
tradeRequest: You may yet serve the Engine...
uniques: [+50]% Production when constructing [Armored] units [in all cities]
Cities are razed [3] times as fast
May buy [Armored] units with [Faith] for [1] times their normal Production cost
No movement cost to pillage <for [Armored] units>
Upon capturing a city, receive [3] times its [Science] production as [Faith] immediately
[-1 Science] [in all cities in which the majority religion is a major religion]

civilopediaText.text: In the beginning, the earth was without form, cold and void. And the Divine Engine moved upon the face of the earth, and brought forth humans, to serve her. And she blessed the people upon the earth with steel and holy oil, to make engines of their own. But the people of the earth forgot the Divine Engine who had blessed them. So the Engine sent forth the Flame to destroy the people who had sinned, and the earth was cleansed. But the Flame had mercy upon the people, and spared the people who repented and swore to serve the Engine. And it came to pass that Divine Engine blessed the people once more, and gave them steel and holy oil, and commanded them to multiply and replenish the earth, for the engine's glory.

Now the people of the earth have begun to forgot the Engine once more. We are called to spread the word of our god, and compel the nations of the earth to repent and serve the Engine. The wrath of the Flame goes before us, and the strength of the Engine is behind us. We are Ignis, and we cannot fail.

name: The Mariners
startIntroPart1: Ahoy, Deacon Hopper of the Mariners. Emerging from the surviving captains and sailors who survived the decivilization of old Earth, you've managed to thrive on the seas and made your way inland. With the riches of both land and sea at your command, you've dreamed of a ship to sail among the stars - a dream that you and your sailors have realized.
startIntroPart2: Deacon Hopper, your sailors wish to roam the oceans once more. Will you conquer the seas of this new world? Can you build a colony that stands the test of time?
declaringWar: The sea is ours, and all the dry lands shall soon be as well!
attacked: Ha! You think to challenge us? I hope you can swim well.
defeated: Damn you! We should never have left the protection of the sea.
introduction: Ahoy! We are the Mariners, and we've come to reclaim the dry land from the lot of you.
tradeRequest: We've got the finest goods that the sea can offer! What do you say?
uniques: Enables [All] units to enter ocean tiles
[1] Movement point cost to disembark <for [All] units>

name: New Afrika
startIntroPart1: Dumela, Mutulu Makkonen of New Afrika. Your people had grown closer together after the decivilization of old Earth, becoming strong together against the rest of the savage world from the grassroots. Your civilization grew and prospered, even catching up with pre-collapse technological progress - and even managing to make your own colony ship to the stars.
startIntroPart2: Mutulu, your people hope for a new horizon for them to prosper. Will you lead them to their promised land? Can you build a colony that stands the test of time?
declaringWar: We've had enough of you messing with us.
attacked: You think you can defeat us? Fool!
defeated: This is the end. Freedom will never be more than a dream.
introduction: I am Mutulu, and we are New Afrika. We are here to rebuild this broken world.
hateHello: What the hell do you want?
tradeRequest: Let's make a fair trade, as equals.
uniques: Enemy [Land] units must spend [1] extra movement points when inside your territory

name: Blue Streak Aerodynamics
startIntroPart1: Howdy, Harvey Hawkes, CEO of Blue Streak Aerodynamics! Coming from a long line of aviators, your grandfather created Blue Streak Aerodynamics before the collapse. Your father then expanded the company from an airplane design bureau into the commercial flight business, and you furthered it by investing into the aerospace sector. You take their legacy in stride, keeping your company afloat even in the face of the collapse, and the subsequent climate catastrophe. But your engineers haven't been idle - they've successfully created and marketed the designs for a spaceship, a colony ship that could take people to new worlds. So it is no surprise when you took one of your own colony ships into the furthest skies, along with the engineers and families wealthy enough to afford a ticket.
startIntroPart2: Harvey, your colonists dream of flying the skies on this new world. Will you reach once more into the sky? Can you build a colony that stands the test of time?
declaringWar: You've done sullied my skies for too long. I'm gonna bomb you back to the stone age!
attacked: Dag nabbit! I'll have you know, this means war!
defeated: Doggone it, you've done clipped my wings.
introduction: Howdy! I'm Harvey Hawkes, CEO of Blue Streak Aerodynamics. See you up above!
hateHello: Well if it isn't the yellowbelly.
tradeRequest: Say, fella, what'd you think of this here trade deal?
